avatar_traits.onscreen_text: To carry a fine blade does not always signify any degree of skill, yet this man has clearly mastered at least the basic strokes and guards.
The sword is the soul of the samurai. That this man wears a sword proclaims not only his status but also that he is more than just a soft man of court.
An attentive pupil to the lessons of his sensei, and an alert observer of his opponent, he is forging a reputation as a skilled blade.
The sword is more than a simple tool - it is also a bridge on the road to one's destiny, a road that this man has travelled now for many miles.
True skill is action independent of thought. To behold this man in battle is to witness a kensei, an immortal master of the blade.
Guidance from an experienced mentor has set this man on the road to becoming an effective leader of men.
A calm demeanour, and a hint of steel in word, gaze and deed are useful attributes for an aspiring commander.
Has acquired the skills required to make his men follow him not only from duty, but also with pride.
On many a battlefield, this man's deft leadership skills have held his men together and brought them through triumphant.
A rock in the tempest of battle, his inspired leadership means that while he stands, his men stand with him to face their destiny and write their names in legend.
The gun is the future, a future that this man has had the foresight to embrace.
Practice breeds assurance, and this man now looks comfortable with a gun in his hand.
Needs only one bullet to achieve what would take another man six.
Can shoot a spinning coin from the air without apparently moving a muscle.
Do you feel lucky, punk?
Engines of war feature prominently in his military strategy.
Follows the philosophy that a balanced army is as flexible as a grove of bamboo before the storm.
Has a reputation for fielding large numbers of mounted troops in his armies.
Is convinced of the merits of an army chiefly composed of melee infantry.
Has shown a tendency to favour large groupings of missile infantry in his army compositions.
With a history of turning tail and running at the first sight of the enemy, this man lacks the courage even to make an honourable end to his own miserable existence.
Has recently taken up the bow.
Yabusami - 'The Way of Horse and Bow' - is a fitting pursuit for a lord of men.
Dedicated practice has seen this man's skill with the bow progress from the awkward fumbling of the novice to something far more fluid and accomplished.
Through countless hours of practice, his bow seems almost an extension of his own arm.
A true master of the bow, the poets liken his skill to a sublime artform.
Guidance from an experienced mentor has set this man on the road to becoming an effective leader of men.
A calm demeanour, and a hint of steel in word, gaze and deed are useful attributes for an aspiring commander.
Has acquired the skills required to make his men follow him not only from duty, but also with pride.
On many a battlefield, this man's deft leadership skills have held his men together and brought them through triumphant.
A rock in the tempest of battle, his inspired leadership means that while he stands, his men stand with him to face their destiny and write their names in legend.
To carry a fine blade does not always signify any degree of skill, yet this man has clearly mastered at least the basic strokes and guards.
The sword is the soul of the samurai. That this man wears a sword proclaims not only his status but also that he is more than just a soft man of court.
An attentive pupil to the lessons of his sensei, and an alert observer of his opponent, he is forging a reputation as a skilled blade.
The sword is more than a simple tool - it is also a bridge on the road to one's destiny, a road that this man has travelled now for many miles.
True skill is action independent of thought. To behold this man in battle is to witness a kensei, an immortal master of the blade.
No more late nights slumped over the Go board nursing a flask of sake and a rounded companion; this man now takes his physical well-being seriously.
Soft living breeds weakness of spirit. This man consciously strives against such a fate through a routine of daily physical activity.
This man's body is a temple, and the rigorous training to which he subjects it is akin to a prayer to the heavens.
